title: Mourning Sampler, late 17th–early 18th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metal thread, paper
Technique: painted silks, silk threads and metal threads laid on parchment or paper with wax
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description: Bishop and two angels looking down from the clouds to bless an Italian town that is on a river by the sea. The angels and the bishop's hands and face were painted on paper which was then cut out and pasted on the picture. Details of the town were painted in by brush. Uncounted stitches.

tombstone.epitaph:
Mourning Sampler, late 17th–early 18th century.
late 17th–early 18th century. Medium: silk, metal thread, paper
Technique: painted silks, silk threads and metal threads laid on parchment or paper with wax. Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection. 1976-100-7.
